Activity: Log in to the system, check emails and project management tools (e.g., Jira, Trello) for any urgent updates or tasks. Since there are no specific goals mentioned in the meeting minutes, I'll review the existing codebase and documentation to identify potential areas for improvement or optimization.

Research and investigate potential tools and technologies that could benefit the game development process. Focus on areas such as build automation, asset management, or debugging tools. Make a list of potential candidates to explore further.
Select one or two promising tools from the research and begin a more in-depth evaluation. Download and install trial versions, read documentation, and experiment with basic functionality.
Lunch break. Check tech news websites (e.g., Hacker News, Reddit's r/programming) for interesting articles or discussions.
Continue evaluating the selected tools. Try to integrate them into a small test project to assess their compatibility with the existing workflow and identify any potential challenges.

Document the findings of the tool evaluation. Create a summary of the pros and cons of each tool, along with recommendations for further investigation or implementation. Start drafting an email to @beng-1 regarding build automation tools and @tart-1 for asset management questions
Organize and prioritize tasks for the rest of the week based on the initial assessment. Prepare a more detailed plan for Tuesday, focusing on the most promising tool candidate.
